title.narrative: Advocating for the Law on Property Tax

description.narrative: Property tax is applied by many countries in the world because of its visibility and often publicly available as tax assets. However, property tax forms such as land and housing tax, agricultural land use tax, land rent, water fees and registration fees ... account for just 0.7% of the Vietnamese total local budget with many restrictions. For example, progressiveness of the tax system is being eroded while budget deficits are becoming commonly. The system of research and advisory agencies serving the National Assembly in legislative, supervisory and decision on important issues is not strong and very few National Assembly deputies have expertise in finance and budget. The project "Advocating for the Law on Property Tax towards the Fair, Equitable and Effective Tax Law" is proposedincluding the following main activities: conducting research on the application of property tax in Vietnam and policy recommendations; organizing consultative workshops for National Assembly deputies and officials of the Finance Department; organizing communication consultations; strengthening the network of activists on property tax law. The lead agency for the project is the Institute for Economic and Policy Research (VEPR), with the close involvement of other members of the Fair Tax Association and BTAP. The Institute for Economic and Policy Research (VEPR) proposed the implementation of the Law on Property Taxation to 1. Enhance progressiveness of the tax system and increase budget resources for social welfare programs, health, education 2. Reduce the hot growth rate and real estate bubble 3. Stabilize the macro economy and creating conditions for the country's economic development Project Outcomes 1. Build Vietnam's tax system fairly, transparently, and efficiently 2. Raise awareness of public finance issues 3. Improve CSOs and state budget to implement social welfare, health, and education programs.

participating-org.narrative: Viet Nam Institute for Economic and Policy Research (VEPR), formerly known as Viet Nam Center for Economic and Policy Research , isa research institute under the University of Economics and Business, Vietnam National University. VEPR considers its primary mission is to carry out economic and policy research which helps policy-making agencies, businesses and interest groups make better desision by providing insights into the nature of the economic movement and the macro policy management in Viet Nam. VEPR works with otherAgriculture Coalition's members, such as Institute for Studies of Society, Economics and Environment (iSEE), Southern Centre for Agriculture Policy (SCAP). Oxfam partly funds and supports in technical aspect for Agriculture Coalition. VEPR represents AgricultureCoalition to receive fund and register with relating authorities.
